questions.question: 1. Radix Sort algorithm starts with the most significant bit of numbers.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Radix sort typically starts with the least significant digit (LSD) and progresses toward the most significant digit.
explanations.b: Correct. Radix sort starts with the least significant digit (LSD) and moves toward the most significant digit, ensuring stable sorting at each digit position.

questions.question: 2. If there are N elements of b digits, how many buckets will be used in radix sort?

explanations.a: Incorrect. The number of buckets depends on the radix (base), not the number of elements.
explanations.b: Incorrect. b represents the number of digits, not the number of buckets needed.
explanations.c: Correct. Radix sort uses 10 buckets (one for each digit 0-9) when sorting decimal numbers, regardless of N or b.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Option c correctly identifies the number of buckets.
